verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329><s%> Musician, <S%H5329><s%> Altaschith, <S%H516><s%> Michtam <S%H4387><s%> of David; <S%H1732><s%> when Saul <S%H7586><s%> sent, <S%H7971><s%> and they watched <S%H8104><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> to kill <S%H4191><s%> him. Deliver <S%H5337><s%> me from my enemies, <S%H341><s%> O my God: <S%H430><s%> defend <S%H7682><s%> me from them that rise <S%H6965><s%> up against me.
Deliver <S%H5337><s%> me from the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity, <S%H205><s%> and save <S%H3467><s%> me from bloody <S%H1818><s%> men. <S%H582><s%>

For, see, <S%H2009><s%> they lie in wait <S%H693><s%> for my soul: <S%H5315><s%> the mighty <S%H5794><s%> are gathered <S%H1481><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me; not for my transgression, <S%H6588><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> for my sin, <S%H2403><s%> O LORD. <S%H3068><s%>
They run <S%H7323><s%> and prepare <S%H3559><s%> themselves without <S%H1097><s%> my fault: <S%H5771><s%> awake <S%H5782><s%> to help <S%H7125><s%> me, and behold. <S%H7200><s%>

You therefore, O LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> awake <S%H6974><s%> to visit <S%H6485><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the heathen: <S%H1471><s%> be not merciful <S%H2603><s%> to any <S%H3605><s%> wicked <S%H205><s%> transgressors. <S%H898><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
They return <S%H7725><s%> at evening: <S%H6153><s%> they make a noise <S%H1993><s%> like a dog, <S%H3611><s%> and go <S%H5437><s%> round <S%H5437><s%> about the city. <S%H5892><s%>
Behold, <S%H2009><s%> they belch <S%H5042><s%> out with their mouth: <S%H6310><s%> swords <S%H2719><s%> are in their lips: <S%H8193><s%> for who, <S%H4310><s%> say they, does hear? <S%H8085><s%>
But you, O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> shall laugh <S%H7832><s%> at them; you shall have all <S%H3605><s%> the heathen <S%H1471><s%> in derision. <S%H3932><s%>
Because of his strength <S%H5797><s%> will I wait <S%H8104><s%> on you: for God <S%H430><s%> is my defense. <S%H4869><s%>
The God <S%H430><s%> of my mercy <S%H2617><s%> shall prevent <S%H6923><s%> me: God <S%H430><s%> shall let me see <S%H7200><s%> my desire on my enemies. <S%H8324><s%>

Slay <S%H2026><s%> them not, lest <S%H6435><s%> my people <S%H5971><s%> forget: <S%H7911><s%> scatter <S%H5128><s%> them by your power; <S%H2428><s%> and bring <S%H3381><s%> them down, <S%H3381><s%> O Lord <S%H136><s%> our shield. <S%H4043><s%>

For the sin <S%H2403><s%> of their mouth <S%H6310><s%> and the words <S%H1697><s%> of their lips <S%H8193><s%> let them even be taken <S%H3920><s%> in their pride: <S%H1347><s%> and for cursing <S%H423><s%> and lying <S%H3585><s%> which they speak. <S%H5608><s%>

Consume <S%H3615><s%> them in wrath, <S%H2534><s%> consume <S%H3615><s%> them, that they may not be: and let them know <S%H3045><s%> that God <S%H430><s%> rules <S%H4910><s%> in Jacob <S%H3290><s%> to the ends <S%H657><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>
And at evening <S%H6153><s%> let them return; <S%H7725><s%> and let them make a noise <S%H1993><s%> like a dog, <S%H3611><s%> and go <S%H5437><s%> round <S%H5437><s%> about the city. <S%H5892><s%>
Let them wander <S%H5128><s%> up and down for meat, <S%H398><s%> and grudge <S%H3885><s%> if <S%H518><s%> they be not satisfied. <S%H7646><s%>

But I will sing <S%H7891><s%> of your power; <S%H5797><s%> yes, I will sing <S%H7442><s%> aloud <S%H7442><s%> of your mercy <S%H2617><s%> in the morning: <S%H1242><s%> for you have been <S%H1961><s%> my defense <S%H4869><s%> and refuge <S%H4498><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of my trouble. <S%H6862><s%>
To you, O my strength, <S%H5797><s%> will I sing: <S%H2167><s%> for God <S%H430><s%> is my defense, <S%H4869><s%> and the God <S%H430><s%> of my mercy. <S%H2617><s%>
